issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Types
components.description: Issues related to Hive Query Languages type system

fields.description:
Constants like 0.1 and 0.3 are differently boxed based on intermediate precision of the compiler codepath.

Disabling CBO produces 0.1BD constants which fail to box correctly to Double/Float.

Enabling CBO fixes this issue, but cannot be applied all queries in Hive.
fields.summary: PPD: Handle FLOAT boxing differently for single/double precision constants

comments.body: The logic looks good to me. Could you add test cases for these with/without CBO?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12909326 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
[~gopalv] how come the tests weren't failing then? can we add a test for the delete with filter 0.1 which was originally causing this issue?

This is the test that fails if I fix it by Boxing from Decimal -> Double.

If I do Decimal -> Float -> Double, it passes. This test fails if I fixed it without the new Enum to box those two differently.

I'll add a 1 row Double test, to cover the broken case.
+1. I wonder why the file system counters are removed for some tests.
